topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Technical Overview

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Sameer V, Pranoy R, Michael B

body.p: This page introduces you to HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade, a carrier-grade distribution of OpenStack(R) the leading open source cloud computing platform.

section.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade services- functional overview
section.p: The following table outlines the functionality of HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade services based on the type of users - Users and Administrators. For a complete description of these services, see the Services Overview page.

section.title: Deployment architecture

section.title: Network architecture
section.p: The following information describes the network configuration for the physical networks and virtual networks, which must be configured by the network administrator.

row.entry: Cloud Management and Object Store Network -- Untagged (Private)
Consumer Access Network (shared with WR - OAM)
External network (FIP network for DCN region); can be on a separate interface (`intf*`)
Block Storage Network; can be on a separate interface (`intf*`)
Data Center Management network (accessible to WR region) and route across multi-DC
Tenant Underlay Network(s); routed across multi-DC for VxLAN 12 extension
Tenant Underlay Network from WR region
Boot/Cloud Management network for WR Cloud/Region -- Untagged
External network (FIP network for WR region)
WR Cloud BLock Storage Network; can be on a separate interface (intf*)

section.title: Interfaces
section.p: The following are the interfaces being used, based on the technical architecture diagram. You can use more than two interfaces and specific networks to physical networks.

ul.li: Intf0 is mapped to Port1/Bonded Pair
Intf1 is mapped to Port2/Bonded Pair
Intfn are Multiple Provider Networks or SR-IOV interfaces.

section.title: Routing ACLs
section.p: Configure the following routing access lists.

row.entry: Access NTP, DNS, LDAP, StoreVirtual APIs, and so forth
Access iLO network for managing the lifecycle of the node
Access external networks, for example to download patches
VSC IP to HLM CLM VM IP (only during deployment)
Inter DC communication (VPN tunnel, BGP, MPLS)
Inter DC communication (VPN tunnel, BGP, MPLS)

section.p: CLM, PXE, OBS, BLS, WR-PXE, WR-INFRA, WR-TUL will use RFC 1918 non-routable IPs to prevent access to the CLM network from DCM, CLT, or EXT.
